title: The Very Short Azumanga Daioh Movie (dual audio).mkv
description:
In this short, 5 minute long movie, Osaka dreams once again about Chiyo-Chan's pigtails being possessed.

Info:

Stream 0:
Type: Video
Codec: MPEG-4 Video (DX50)
Language: English
Resolution: 640x350

Stream 1:
Type: Audio
Codec: MPEG Audio layer 1/2/3 (mpga)
Language: English
Sample rate: 44100 Hz

Stream 2:
Type: Audio
Codec: MPEG Audio layer 1/2/3 (mpga)
Language: Japanese
Sample rate: 44100 Hz

Stream 3:
Type: Subtitle
Codec: Text subtitles with various tags (subt)
Language: English
Description: Azumanga Daioh: The Movie

Please be kind, this is my first attempt at using AVI-Mux GUI to combine video, English audio, Japanese audio, and subs into one file, and I had to use Leawo Video Converter to convert the original video from .MP4 to .AVI and I've only just recently learned how to adjust the resolution to save space on my 40GB computer, so I know the resolution isn't that great. For some reason, the English audio is a bit choppy on my computer, but the Japanese audio plays fine if just a little behind the video. Any help on fixing these problems would be greatly appreciated.
